subtitle: These Scotch pancakes are at their best when just cooked and still warm. They are delicious served simply with a knob of butter or with preserves, honey or syrup.

method.text: Mix together the flour and sugar in a large bowl. Make a well in the centre. Stir in the egg with enough milk to make a batter the same consistency as thick cream when beaten together.
Drop 4 small spoonfuls of the mixture, spaced well apart, onto a lightly greased hot griddle or heavy-based frying pan.

Cook the pancakes for 2-3 min at a steady heat, until bubbles rise to the surface of the pancake and burst. Then turn the pancakes with a palette knife and cook for a further 2-3 min until golden. Keep the pancakes warm whilst cooking the remainder.
Serve the pancakes while still warm with butter or preserves, golden or maple syrup, or honey.

title: Griddle pancakes
